Investigate Python's origins, history, a.title: Python (programming language)
Investigate Python's origins, history, a.summary: Python was conceived in the late 1980s by Guido van Rossum at Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) in the Netherlands.
key_points: Conceived by Guido van Rossum in the late 1980s
Designed as a successor to ABC programming language
Released in 1991 as Python 0.9.0

Investigate Python's origins, history, a.title: History of Python Programming Language - Student Work
Investigate Python's origins, history, a.summary: Python is a programming language that has continually increased in popularity and use since its conception in the late 1980s.
key_points: Became open source shortly after conception
Guido van Rossum still maintains a central role in deciding the language's direction
Large and comprehensive standard library

Investigate Python's origins, history, a.title: Python Wasn't Built in a Day: An Origin Story Worth Knowing
Investigate Python's origins, history, a.summary: Python was derived from its predecessor, a project called ABC, and was inspired by the frustration with the economic reality of the 1980s.

Inspired by frustration with 1980s economic realities

Investigate Python's origins, history, a.title: The Evolution of Python - Codefinity
